37038462da1c0f5a31d9319cbe4dbcfc (17:09): I'll try that...
37038462da1c0f5a31d9319cbe4dbcfc (17:10): Oh, I had that before!!
37038462da1c0f5a31d9319cbe4dbcfc (17:10): Then yesterday in this room, they told me that I shouldn't mix float: left with position: relative in the design
37038462da1c0f5a31d9319cbe4dbcfc (17:11): It does work though....
37038462da1c0f5a31d9319cbe4dbcfc (17:11): Does anyhting speak against mixing those two things in good design?
37038462da1c0f5a31d9319cbe4dbcfc (17:12): vice-versa: Ah, here we are. I know why I changed that. Can you look at the page in IE??
62fba5811243f518935848d952809f8c (17:12): socken: It depends on what you're doing...
62fba5811243f518935848d952809f8c (17:12): Using two properties on a page doesn't tell us anything about how they're interacting.
37038462da1c0f5a31d9319cbe4dbcfc (17:13): ok.. So in this case it's ok I guess!?
62fba5811243f518935848d952809f8c (17:13): I haven't looked at the code, so I can't say.
37038462da1c0f5a31d9319cbe4dbcfc (17:14): The problem is, now that I've changed it back to float:left, I get a gap between the menu and the content.. (only in IE)
93dede99112199d049a1bc421e564cd4 (17:15): socken: 3px text jog ie bug me thinks
c95720c193df40ce1618d1b00b040b42 (17:15): ie hacks 3px: www.positioniseverything.net/explorer/threepxtest.html

37038462da1c0f5a31d9319cbe4dbcfc (17:16): Hey, can I sue Micro$oft, because I have to spend 5 times longer only to get a page work in IE!?
37038462da1c0f5a31d9319cbe4dbcfc (17:16): hehe
62fba5811243f518935848d952809f8c (17:16): Your users are the ones using the browser. Talk to them.

37038462da1c0f5a31d9319cbe4dbcfc (17:16): I know, you're right...
37038462da1c0f5a31d9319cbe4dbcfc (17:17): If it's for me, I'd deleted it a looong time ago
62fba5811243f518935848d952809f8c (17:17): Educate, don't hyberolate.

d086a635c2f2d3689d351443f620dc3b (17:36): guys, got a question

d086a635c2f2d3689d351443f620dc3b (17:37): there's textboxs on the right hand side of my site, if I don't specify the div they are in as 'overflow: hidden;', the textboxes like to extend past the width of the div
d086a635c2f2d3689d351443f620dc3b (17:37): is there a better way to constrain their length so they fit within the bounds of the parent div?
9920d6643d41cf6be396aa8aa4d599c2 (17:39): How do i place a div in the lower right corner of the div it is placed in?
37038462da1c0f5a31d9319cbe4dbcfc (17:40): nibbo: outer div -> position: relative; inner div -> position: absolute; bottom: 0; right: 0;
37038462da1c0f5a31d9319cbe4dbcfc (17:40): I still have difficulties solving that 3 pixel jog bug!!
37038462da1c0f5a31d9319cbe4dbcfc (17:41): Can't I just set a negative margin of -3px for the div (with * html so it's only for IE)
37038462da1c0f5a31d9319cbe4dbcfc (17:41): AH, it works!!!
37038462da1c0f5a31d9319cbe4dbcfc (17:42): I only set the left margin of the right div do -3px, but I also have to set margin-right for the left one...
37038462da1c0f5a31d9319cbe4dbcfc (17:42): Halleluja
d086a635c2f2d3689d351443f620dc3b (17:44): thanks b0at... I'm getting too tired, of course what you suggested fixed it up
9920d6643d41cf6be396aa8aa4d599c2 (17:44): socken: Thanks man!
37038462da1c0f5a31d9319cbe4dbcfc (17:45): nibbo: Keep in mind, if you set position: absolute; the position is set absolut to the next div that is positioned relative!
9920d6643d41cf6be396aa8aa4d599c2 (17:46): ah ok, thanks :)
